title: Firefox opens by itself
content:
Firefox opens by itself

hello!

I've had a strange problem with firefox for a few days - from time to time a new - empty firefox window opens out of a blue. I think it's some kind of virus.

I scanned the system - all disks, memory, etc. with various programs in safe mode with no results: -AdvCleaner -Malwarebytes -tdsskiller -Spybot-S&D Start Center -ESET internet security -kaspersky antivirus e.t.c. They found absolutely nothing.

I also reinstalled firefox several times: 1st time: when I tried to delete and when unistaling firefox - he kept opening non-stop - some 10+ times - every time a new firefox with a blank page window. // i also deleted extra folders in appdata etc.

2nd time: I removed firefox and all the remnants including the keys in the registry and in Appdata / roaming etc., I also changed firefox's parsing from d:\ to c:\ and after a clean, fresh install (without any addons) firefox still opens by itself...

I have ESET IE and Malwarebytes running as protection and now: when I entered the filmweb.pl website, something like this popped up:

-Web site data- Category: Trojan Domain: fwcdn.pl IP address: 193.200.227.41 Port: 443 Type: Outgoing File: C: \ Program Files \ Mozilla Firefox \ firefox.exe


The page did not load - it was broken, in addition, I once accidentally entered the fwcdn.pl website but there 'supposedly' nothing, but there is some reference to amazon in the source of the page...

please help ;|

title: Revert to older version of Firefox
content:
I have an old Macbook Pro, model 5.5 from 2009 running OS 10.6.8. I was running Firefox v48 on it, but couldn't open a particular webpage. So I tried to update Firefox to the latest version, v82. Stupidly I overwrote the old version. Turns out the latest v of Firefox won't open or install on my old Mac OS. I should have known this. Anyway, too late.

Is there any way of recovering v48? Or of downloading it again? I've read the warnings about security holes etc, and I know the risks. I would like to get Firefox running on this old Mac again if possible. All advice gratefully received! Thank you. Charlie

PS - I'm writing this from my newer Mac, with the latest OS and Firefox installed.

title: Mentett bejelentkezések
content:
T. Mozilla!

Nagyjából 1-2 hónapja a Firefox elindításakor egy Google tájékoztató jelenik meg. Mivel már nagyon untam, hogy állandóan jóvá kell hagynom az ott leírtakat ahhoz, hogy a programot érdemben használni tudjam, így úgy döntöttem, hogy a google oldalon bejelentkezem és ezáltal talán elkerülhetem a folyamatos popup ablakot. Sikeresen be is jelentkeztem, elmentettem a bejelentkezési adatokat a programban és kikapcsoltam, hogy az aktív bejelentkezések ne kerüljenek törlésre a Firefox-ból történő kilépéskor. Ettől függetlenül minden egyes kilépés után a program kijelentkeztet a Google oldalról, mert az újbóli belépéskor ismét be kell jelentkeznem. (Mondjuk legalább nem kell beírni az adatokat.) Próbáltam már minden lehetséges megoldást, amit a neten találtam, de egyik sem oldotta meg a kérdést. Tudnának segíteni, hogyan kell beállítani a programot, hogy az aktív bejelentkezések a kilépés után is megmaradjanak?

Köszönettel, Popini Gábor

title: more user accounts with the same login name on the same server
content:
Hi, I found that recent update of Firefox is not compatible with multiple user accounts on the same server. The problem is that Firefox does not allow to store password for a certain page, but only for a server. Specifically, the problem I have now that the server www.editorialmanager.com is used by many different Journals (and I must have an access to more than 15 journals), but all require me to have the same login name (to be recognized as a special editor)! For logical reasons I do not want to have all passwords the same, but when I set a password for one journal, it overwrites all other passwords... The problem is that Firefox does not allow to store a password for a certain page, but only for a server.

Here is the example:

1 www.editorialmanager.com/ejmech login: my professional email passwd: 123

2 www.editorialmanager.com/bmchem login: my professional email passwd: overwritten to be the same - 123

3 www.editorialmanager.com/bmchem login: my professional email passwd: overwritten to be the same - 123

How to cope with this problem? Thank you for your help. Best, Vladimir

title: Switching between Profiles when using Firefox Default and Firefox Developer with multiple Profiles
content:
Hi Guys,

i have a question regarding the recommended use of multiple profiles on different browsers (Firefox Default & Firefox Developer).

Occasionally it happens to me, that i try to open a profile in the wrong Browser, e.g. open a Firefox Developer Profile in Firefox Default (or vice versa). Since, as far as i understand, the Browser do have different Versions, everytime this happens the Profile i try to open gets down-/upgraded and is broken(?). Afterwards i delete the Profile and just copy a Backup inside the Profiles Folder which is exhausting and sometimes the backup is way older than the actual Version, so i have to Backup all Bookmarks and Settings of the broken Profile manually and then import them again, when I use my older Backup.

My Installation directory should be default and therefore the same for both Browsers. Maybe I should just install them in seperate Locations? But wouldn't the Profile Folder in /AppData/ still be the same and i had the same Problem when opening a wrong profile by accident? How can I get rid off braking my profiles by accident? Right now i changed the order of the Profiles and seperated Default & Devleoper Profiles from eacht other with a "seperation profile" in between them named "______________________", so I don't accidentely open the wrong Profile in about:profiles, but there has to be a better solution, right? I also checked out the Profile Manager, but don't see the benefit in switching between Profiles. I probably could use shortcuts, make a shortcut for every Default Profile and a shortcut for every Developer Profile i have and open them by click, but i prefer to switch Profiles in about:config or at least that's the most comfortable way i know to do it.

Thanks for your Help

title: GMX Mail
content:
I have used Firefox (Windows 10 ) to connect to GMX Mail with no problems for some years. Firefox is the browser I prefer to use all the time.

Recently, on both a desktop and a laptop, Firefox appears to be forcing me to the GMX smartphone App instead of the regular Windows-friendly site. This prevents me logging on to GMX Mail - it simply does not work on Windows.

I see this problem surfaced some six years ago, and must have been fixed, however, it now seems to have returned. It was agreed back then that it was a Firefox problem, not a GMX problem.

I can log into GMX with Microsoft Edge, and will have to use that for now, until the issue is fixed.

I ask that Firefox resolves this issue as soon as possible.
creator: wdtk

title: POST request is doesn't handled by firefox
content:
Hi everyone,

From few weeks (two or three) I encounter a problem in specific conditions.

A/ Description of the problem

In my application developped in angular, I send some requests (POST, GET, PATCH) to my API (hosted on the same server). Since few weeks, a specific request is not properly handled by firefox. The request is sended to the API, but it doesn't appear in the "network" tab of the inspector (opened with F12), so that my application can't get the return of the API.


B/ More in depht

More precisions about the problem : - the server use HTTPS with auto-signed certificate - the request is called as POST - the array of posted data is more than 10 short elements sized - the API return a message in few minuts (the app wait correctly the return)


C/ What I tested before ask here ? - Using a different navigator (exclude a programming problem) --> works - Try to make an other POST request, here for login (works fine) (exclude API or security problem) --> works - Using a old version of firefox (62) --> works fine - Then update to actual firefox version (82.0.2) --> doesn't works anymore - Using "private navigation" --> works - Delete cached data and cookies --> doesn't change anything - When I'm developping I use a local webserver for the web application, but the target API is the same --> works (and using same version of firefox)


D/ The request doesn't appear in the network tracker tab This THE mysterious point : when I launch the network tab, I can see all requests sended by my application. I GET my differents pages fine, I can log-in fine using POST (and I see this request), but when I would launch the other POST request : firefox doesn't catch any new request. In normal case, firefox catch the request and waits for a response ; but now : there's nothing.

I join you screenshots in both normal & private navigation modes. In private navigation mode, we can see that firefox handled the POST request and waits for response In "normal" mode, when can't see the POST request, but we can see that a PATCH request works In addition, the last image show the access.log of the Apache2 server, and we can see that the API give the response (but firefox doens't see that)


I don't very know where to search now, this is why I post my message here, I hope someone helps me ! :) Thanks in advance and sorry for english mistakes !

title: URGENT - Firefox frozen by malware webpage
content:
Can ANYONE help please?!?

I clicked on a link in Google search and a webpage opened clearly with a malware. Unfortunately, my Bitdefender Total Security did not stop it - which means it is not as good as its developers claim it is.

The webpage opened several dialogue windows such as a login window asking to Cancel to continue; a colour picker, user account etc.. I can't close them, can't click on anything in the browser, everything, all menus etc is completely frozen. Of course, I will not click on any of those windows as it could be a virus or ransomware or something.

I had to close the browser via Task Manager. I have restarted my PC few times, shut it down and reopened it - didn't help. The moment I open Firefox that malware is there. I opened Firefox in a safe mode - no change. I tried to do system restore - it didn't complete - saying that there was a file it could not access in the restore, so nothing was changed. It looks like this malware is preventing system restore. My PC is new - bought only two months ago. I have Windows 10 pro.

I can use other browsers like Chrome, but Firefox is my main browser with hundreds of bookmarks I use daily and many new ones from my research. I can't lose them.

I can't even refresh Firefox as I can't click on ANYTHING in the browser.

When I try to close those malware windows, they open a new full screen page to cover the taskbar - luckily I have two screens.

Could someone please help me recover my Firefox ASAP without losing my bookmarks. If I uninstall it and then reinstall - I will lose them all.

Also - I believe that Firefox as an inbuilt website protection to block this sort of malware websites from opening - so, where was this protection??

Are people (Firefox support) aware of this type of malware and how to fix it?

thanks
creator: magicpowers888

title: Webpages won't load only in Firefox following Windows 10 update
content:
Following a recent update to windows 10, when I try to load a webpage in Firefox, it just loads forever. It never moves from the Firefox homepage, but the loading dot moves about. I have left it loading for about half an hour before closing Firefox, at which point I get an request to send a crash report to Mozilla.

I've tried refreshing and reinstalling Firefox, with the same problem. It only occurs with Firefox, no other browser

I can't recall if I used Firefox successfully after the update, but I only noticed having this issue this morning, a day or two after the update

Any ideas?

title: Syncing a new client overwrites my top sites
content:
So I have a Firefox account and always sign in to my browser and enable sync. I then go and manually add my preferred top sites, so they're always available on my new tab page.

I then realise how much I'm enjoying Firefox over Google Chrome and switch my other systems over to Firefox and sign in and enable sync. This doesn't sync the tops sites I've configured in my first install, but worse than that, the new Top sites I get by default on my second install are then synced across to my first installation, wiping out the top sites I've painstakingly set on my first install.

I then remember why I keep returning to Google Chrome, as I'm quite precious about my top sites being as I like them, and Google Chrome handles this perfectly. Whenever I sign in to Chrome, it populates all my top sites, and even puts them in the same order.

Is there a way to get Firefox to correctly remember my top sites, so when I sync a new install (which I do a lot), it doesn't wipe out my preferred top sites replacing them with default links that I'm not interested in?

I've looked for extensions to do this, and have even tried emulating this with a static HTML web page containing the links I want, but even setting a custom page for new tabs or windows to do this isn't as easy as it should be.
creator: bryan20

title: How to select form element values with normal texts at the same time

But in Firefox I can select either normal texts or one form element value. This is inconvience when copy an article mixed with texts and form elements. Eg. 

   My name is <input name="name"/>


Is it possible to change this behaviour?

title: Problem with VMWARE Workstation pro when Firefox is running
content:
I have Intel CPU laptop with 16GB ram, Windows 10 (1903) I have Firefox running with roughly 40 tabs open. Task manager says it takes around 1 GB Ram It also says that 8 GB system memory is still free. When I start virtual machine in VMWARE (ver. 16) I get a problem. (VM is configured to use 6 GR of RAM.) VMWare reports an error when opening the vdmk file for some reason. If I click on retry usually system crashes. (no message, just black screen, never responding). In some cases it responds after several minutes but crashes later. Sometimes Firefox crashes, it simply disappears from screen.

I tried to investigate what could be the reason and I tried different combinations but this happens only when Firefox is open. If I have any other memory intensive programs open and I open VM it never crashes.

Anybody having the same issue?

Thanks for help

Jaro

title: Find Bookmark Location
content:
I have hundreds of FireFox bookmarks organized in bookmarks folders and subfolders which makes sense most of the time.

However, with seldom used bookmarks, often I cannot remember where the bookmark itself is located, and, I need like to find the bookmark and note the folder where it resides then perhaps move the bookmark to a folder that makes more sense the next time it's needed.

While I can "search" bookmarks and use the bookmark, there is no apparent way to determine where the bookmark itself is located, so, I am forced to use "search" every time I need to use it. "Abandoning" a lost bookmark location and creating a duplicate does not seem right.

There MUST be a way to find where a bookmark is located. What am I missing?

Thanks in advance, Beverly Howard
creator: bevhoward

title: Firefox Cookies Being Deleted
content: Since the most recent Firefox for Windows update, all of my Firefox browsers on my PCs have suddenly stopped saving my already logged in cookies for my major use websites, such as Facebook, Outlook, Amazon, and Netflix. For the past few years, these websites all stay logged in, even when I have Firefox set to delete cookies when the browser is closed, in part because I have these websites all carefully noted in the cookies and site data exceptions. As I said, I've never had problems for the past few years. But since the most recent update a few weeks ago, all of my websites log me out after 24 hrs. I even changed the main cookies settings to not delete any cookies when the browser is closed, but that makes no difference. Something has changed in the most recent Firefox that has disabled the managed exceptions to cookie deletion. I'd love some help on how to fix this, as changing settings does not seem to do it.
creator: decorus_veritas
